intro: Hedyotis longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed dotweed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Hedyotis longipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks.
